context: iPod <a3_0>batteries<a3_0/> are not designed to be removed or replaced by the user, although some users have been able to open the case themselves, usually following instructions from <a0_0>third-party vendors<a0_0/> of iPod replacement batteries. Compounding the problem, Apple initially would not replace worn-out batteries. The official policy was that the customer should buy a <a1_0>refurbished replacement iPod<a1_0/>, at a cost almost equivalent to a brand new one. All <a2_0><a4_0>lithium-ion<a4_0/><a2_0/> batteries lose capacity during their lifetime even when not in use (guidelines are available for prolonging life-span) and this situation led to a market for third-party battery replacement kits.
